h1: Calories in 1 Pound of Ground Beef
assumptions: 80% lean ground beef, cooked (pan-broiled), fat drained; no added seasonings or oils; 1 pound = 454 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by lean percentage, cooking method, fat drainage, brand, and portion accuracy. Check labels or use a food scale for precision.

quick_answer.text: 1 pound of cooked 80% lean ground beef provides ~1117 kcal and ~118 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 pound of cooked ground beef?
faqs.a: About 1117 kcal for 80% lean, pan-broiled and drained.

faqs.q: What's the protein in 1 pound of ground beef?
faqs.a: Approximately 118 g protein, making it a high-protein option.

faqs.q: Does lean percentage affect calories in ground beef?

faqs.q: Are these values for raw or cooked ground beef?
faqs.a: Cooked (pan-broiled). Raw is similar but cooking reduces weight by ~20-30% due to fat and water loss.

faqs.q: How much fat is in 1 pound of 80% lean ground beef?
faqs.a: Around 70 g total fat, including 27 g saturated fat.
